title: How to Make Rose Brandy

steps.headline: Gather the petals of roses while there is dew on them.
Fill with rose petals.
steps.description: As soon as the petals open after picking (if you have picked buds), put them into a wide-mouthed bottle.

steps.headline: Add the brandy.
steps.description: When the bottle is full of rose petals, pour in good quality brandy.

steps.headline: Leave for three to four weeks to steep.
Use as wished.
steps.description: Rose brandy is suitable to add as a flavoring to pastries and pudding sauces, as a cake flavoring or as a drink on its own.

text: Gather the petals of roses while there is dew on them.  Fill with rose petals. As soon as the petals open after picking (if you have picked buds), put them into a wide-mouthed bottle. Add the brandy. When the bottle is full of rose petals, pour in good quality brandy. Leave for three to four weeks to steep.  Use as wished. Rose brandy is suitable to add as a flavoring to pastries and pudding sauces, as a cake flavoring or as a drink on its own.
